title: Dramatic Comeback Against Fulham
summary: Newcastle bounced back in the Premier League on 25 October 2025 with a 2–1 win over Fulham. Jacob Murphy scored first, and Bruno Guimarães netted a last-minute winner, showing the team’s determination and leadership on the pitch.
content:
On 25 October 2025, Newcastle rebounded with a thrilling 2–1 victory over Fulham at St James’ Park. Jacob Murphy opened the scoring early on, but Fulham equalized through Sasa Lukic, and the match looked destined for a draw.

In the final moments, Bruno Guimarães rose to the occasion, converting a rebound to secure all three points. The win was a huge morale boost, demonstrating Newcastle’s ability to fight until the very end.

It also highlighted the leadership of Guimarães, whose influence in midfield and knack for crucial goals have become increasingly vital for the club.

title: Newcastle United’s Champions League Triumph Over Benfica
summary: Newcastle secured a convincing 3–0 win over Benfica on 21 October 2025, with goals from Anthony Gordon and Harvey Barnes. The Magpies dominated both defensively and offensively, strengthening their position in the Champions League group stage.
content:
On 21 October 2025, Newcastle United delivered a statement performance in the UEFA Champions League with a commanding 3–0 victory over Benfica at St James’ Park. The Magpies dominated from the first whistle, showcasing sharp attacking play and disciplined defense.

Anthony Gordon opened the scoring with a precise strike, and Harvey Barnes came off the bench to score twice, sealing a memorable win. Newcastle’s midfield controlled the tempo, with Lewis Miley stepping in impressively to cover for Sandro Tonali.

The clean sheet demonstrated that the team is not only capable of scoring but also of shutting down strong European opposition. This result strengthened Newcastle’s position in their group and showed fans that the club is serious about making an impact on the continental stage.

title: Premier League Setback Against Brighton
summary: On 18 October 2025, Newcastle narrowly lost 2–1 to Brighton, despite a clever goal from Nick Woltemade. The match highlighted defensive lapses but also showed flashes of attacking creativity that will be key moving forward.
content:
Before their Champions League clash, Newcastle faced Brighton on 18 October in the Premier League and suffered a narrow 2–1 defeat. Despite a solid performance, defensive lapses proved costly.

Nick Woltemade scored for Newcastle with a clever backheel finish, but Danny Welbeck’s clinical touch gave Brighton the edge. The match highlighted Newcastle’s ongoing challenge balancing European commitments with domestic consistency.

Although the loss was disappointing, the team showed flashes of attacking creativity and resilience that will be crucial in the weeks ahead.
